Summary I'm an Algorithm Engineer in the Algorithms R&D Group at Universal Audio with expertise as well as experience in both industry and academia in the areas of signal processing, multi-agent systems, communications, machine learning, and economics/game theory. Generally I'm interested in challenging engineering problems that involve some subset of these areas. 
 
Concurrently I'm also a part-time lecturer at Stanford University teaching an upper-division course offered by the Department of Management Science & Engineering on optimization theory and related applications. 
 
Previously held positions have been at Apple Computers, MIT Lincoln Laboratory, KDDI R&D Laboratories (Japan), Qualcomm, and Morgan Stanley (New York and Tokyo). Most recently I was an Assistant Professor at the Singapore University of Technology and Design. 
 
I earned a Ph.D. degree from Stanford University in 2011, an S.M. degree from MIT in 2001, and a B.S. degree from the University of California at San Diego in 1999 (with honors), all in electrical engineering. While an undergraduate I also spent a year as a visiting research student in the Department of Information Engineering at the Tokyo Institute of Technology. Experience Algorithm Engineer, Algorithms R&D Group Universal Audio June 2014  – Present (1 year 3 months) Scotts Valley, California Research and development, including software implementation, of signal processing and statistical learning algorithms for a variety of industry-leading real-time music and audio processing solutions for musicians and music producers.  Lecturer Stanford University March 2015  – Present (6 months) Palo Alto, California Lecturer for MS&E 111 Introduction to Optimization, an upper-division course offered by the Department of Management Science & Engineering on optimization theory and related applications. Assistant Professor, Engineering Systems and Design Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD) June 2012  –  March 2014  (1 year 10 months) singapore Conducted multidisciplinary research, taught courses (in mathematics, optimization, and economics), and advised students (undergraduate and graduate). In addition, consulted with local industry. Fellow, Division of Mathematical Sciences Nanyang Technological University November 2011  –  June 2012  (8 months) Singapore Postdoctoral researcher in the Algorithmic Game Theory Group and taught an upper-division course on discrete mathematics. Research Intern, Statistical Arbitrage Group PDT Partners June 2007  –  December 2007  (7 months) Greater New York City Area Designed, developed, and implemented (C++, Matlab) large-scale dynamic optimization algorithms to improve the fund's portfolio trading strategies. Offered full-time researcher position upon project completion (declined). Research Intern, Video Coding Group Apple Computers June 2004  –  September 2004  (4 months) Cupertino, California Developed methods for efficiently finding parameters for weighted prediction in the H.264/AVC video coding standard.  Associate, Equity Trading Division Morgan Stanley February 2001  –  April 2004  (3 years 3 months) Tokyo, Japan Performed data analysis/statistical studies and developed software (C++, Perl, Python, Matlab) for the improvement of automated dynamic trading strategies for large complex portfolios. In addition, actively traded client portfolios. Passed on first attempt levels I and II of the Japan Securities Dealers Association exams (in Japanese). Research Assistant, Human Language Technology Group MIT Lincoln Laboratory January 2000  –  January 2001  (1 year 1 month) Lexington, Massachusetts Conducted research in automatic speaker recognition, part of which developed into S.M. thesis (MIT). Portions of work referenced in a major textbook on speech processing published by Prentice Hall ("Discrete-Time Signal Processing", by Thomas Quatieri). Intern, Wireless Communications Research Group KDDI R&D Laboratories Inc. July 2000  –  September 2000  (3 months) Saitama, Saitama, Japan Performed mathematical analysis and computer simulations to improve the group's algorithms for mitigating fast channel fading. Developed a large-scale channel fading model used by various researchers at KDDI. Software Engineering Intern, Vocoder R&D Group Qualcomm November 1996  –  September 1997  (11 months) Greater San Diego Area Assisted in the development of the company’s speech processing technology. Designed hardware and developed multiple components of a vocoder testing platform (C++) that was provided to customers for evaluation of the vocoder chipset. Summary My career has been dedicated to the theme of forging cross-sector partnerships to test new models and extend proven approaches to unleashing innovation in service of human development and environmental conservation. In addition to working in the areas of impact investing, market-based solutions to environmental challenges, STEM education, and social enterprise, I am interested in how resilience mindsets and skill sets can advance sustainable development. I am motivated by the belief that individuals, enterprises and complex systems grounded in authentic purpose and equipped with flexible and resilient orientations will thrive. Experience Founder & CEO Resilience in Action 2013  – Present (2 years) Portland, Oregon Resilience in Action (RIA) prepares leaders to accelerate the transition to a sustainable society by building their capacity to practice resilience.  
 
Resilience in Action is dedicated to helping 21st century leaders cultivate resilience in their lives, organizations and sectors. RIA designs innovative executive curriculum, leads resilience journeys to dynamic natural environments like the Peruvian Amazon, and partners with companies to enhance strategic clarity.  
 
Resilience, the core trait of individuals and systems that can absorb and recover from stresses and shocks, is critical to tackling 21st century challenges. RIA distills core features of resilient systems and translates them into practical tools, supporting leaders in building mindsets and skillets that make them stronger and equip them to accelerate the transition to a sustainable society. RIA designs and runs leadership development programs that help leaders develop keystone resilience habits, enabling them to Connect, Adapt & Innovate. Lecturer Stanford University 2013  – Present (2 years) Lecturer: "Building a Sustainable Society: Integrating Human and Environmental Priorities" 
 
Co-Director: "Conservation and Development Dilemmas in the Amazon" field course. Chief Executive Officer Washington STEM 2011  –  January 2012  (1 year) WA STEM seeks to catalyze and scale innovative and effective models for science, technology, engineering and math teaching and learning. The organization works throughout Washington state at the K-12 level, with a focus on historically underserved communities. Julia led the organization during its start-up year, recruiting staff and board members, building systems and strategy. The organization made $2.6 million in investments, reaching over 11,000 students and 300 teachers in 2011. Executive Director The Lemelson Foundation 2002  –  January 2011  (9 years) The Lemelson Foundation is dedicated to improving lives through invention. During Julia's tenure, the Foundation built a professional staff, launched an international program to nurture local inventors and entrepreneurs in designing and distributing affordable technologies to meet basic human needs and advance sustainable development, doubled its annual grantmaking, established a permanent HQ in Portland in a LEED-Platinum certified building, and increased its focus on K-12 STEM education for underserved communities in the U.S. Lecturer Stanford University 2000  –  2002  (2 years) Law School, Human Biology, Anthropological Sciences, Earth Sciences Designed and taught courses for undergraduate and graduate students in fisheries management, marine conservation and ocean law. Director, Pacific Office & Director, Community Fisheries World Wildlife Fund 1997  –  2002  (5 years) Palo Alto, California Directed the Marine Stewardship Council fisheries certification strategy for community fisheries in developing countries.
